item.title: Compsci 61B
item.description: This is where I will be keeping all of my notes throughout the semester for CS61B. Select a week/chapter on the left to get started! Course Info From the UC Berkeley Academic Guide: This course and its follow-on course EECS16B focus on the fundamentals of designing modern information devices and systems that interface with the real world. Together, this course sequence provides a comprehensive foundation for core EECS topics in signal processing, learning, control, and circuit design while introducing key linear-algebraic concepts motivated by application contexts.
